TopicTitle: Problem with the Kethane mod! Please help!!!

Articles.Content:
Today i put a kethane miner into low Minmus orbit (25 km) and I left it for some hours to detect kethane. Then I put the coordinates of the last deposit into MechJeb's landing guidance. I started mining aaaand no kethane

Please Help!!!
Maybe you've typed it wrong. Could you send the coordinates or the generated map please so I can take a look?

Negative numbers on the kethane gui translate to different directions in mechjeb. (EG. 25.2,-175.3 is 25.2N, 175.3W) a negative in the first number means west and a negative in the second number means south. In mechjeb make sure you have the correct compass direction selected when typing it in.

Maybe your miner is just off the edge of the deposit. To avoid this, I always put the little detector on my miners. It's mainly to confirm they are on a deposit, but it also enables the miner to use the map.

Maybe your miner is just off the edge of the deposit. To avoid this, I always put the little detector on my miners. It's mainly to confirm they are on a deposit, but it also enables the miner to use the map.

*FrontierProject modifies all his miners so future models have a scanner on them

I am new here soo how do i send things?
